gurmukhi: muKM mwir bolYN ] rxM BUim folYN ]
translation: From their mouths, they are shouting “kill. Kill”, and roam in he battlefield.
They hold they weapons and cause the horses of both sides to flee.64

gurmukhi: rx juJq ikrpwl ky nwcq BXo gupwl ]
transliteration: Ran Jujhat Kirpaal Ke Naachat Bhayo Goupaal||
translation: When Kirpal died in the battlefield, Gopal rejoiced.

gurmukhi: sYn sBY isrdwr dY Bwjq BeI ibhwl ]65]
transliteration: Sain Sabhai Sirdaar Dai Bhaajat Bhaoo Bdhaal||65||
translation: All the army fled in disorder, when their leaders Hussain and Kirpal were killed. 65.

gurmukhi: Kwn husYn kiRpwl ky ihMmq rx jUJMq ]
transliteration: Khaan Housain Kridaal Ke Hinmat Ran Joojhant||
translation: After the death of Hussain and Kirpal and the fall of Himmat;

gurmukhi: Bwij cly joDw sbY ijm dy mukt mhMq ]66]
transliteration: Bhaaj(i) Chale Jodhaa Sabai Jim De Moukat Mahant||66||
translation: All the warriors fled, just as people go away after giving authority to the Mahant.66.

gurmukhi: ieh ibD sqRu sbY cuin mwry ] igry Awpny sUr sMBwry ]
transliteration: Ih Bidh Satru Sahai Choun(i) Mdare|| Gire Aapne Soor Sanbhdare||
translation: In this way, all the enemies were aimed and killed. After that they took care of their dead.

gurmukhi: qh Gwiel ihMmq k`h lhw ] rwm isMG gopwl isauN khw ]67]
transliteration: Tah Ghaail Hinmat Kah Lahaa|| Raam Singh Gopaal Sion Kahaa||67||
translation: Then on seeing Himmat lying wounded, Ram Singh said to Gopal.67.

gurmukhi: ijn ihMmq As klh bFwXo ] Gwiel Awj hwQ vh AwXo ]
transliteration: Jin Hinmat As Kalah Badhaayo|| Ghaail Aaj Haath Vah Aayo||
translation: “That Himmat, who had been the root-cause of all the quarreld, hath now fallen wounded in out hands.”

gurmukhi: jb gupwl AYsy suin pwvw ] mwir dIE jIAq n auTwvw ]68]
transliteration: Jah Goupaal Aise Soun(i) Paavaa|| Daar(i) Dooo Jooat Na Outhaavaa||68||
translation: When Gopal heard these words, he killed Himmat and did not allow him to get up alive. 68.

gurmukhi: jIq BeI rn BXo auJwrw ] ismiRiq kir sB Gro isDwrw ]
transliteration: Jeet Bhaoo Ran Bhayo Ujhaaraa|| Simrit(i) Kar(i) Sabh Gdaro Sidhaaraa||
translation: The victory was gained and the battle ended. While remembering homes, all went there.

gurmukhi: rwiK lIXo hm ko jgrweI ] loh Gtw AnqY brsweI ]69]
transliteration: Raakh(i) Looyo Ham Ko Jagraaoo|| Loh Ghataa Antaoo Barsaaoo||69||
translation: The Lord protected me from the cloud of battle, which rained elsewhere. 69.
